examples: The time passed quickly.
The cruise went very quickly.
The eggs cook quickly in a hot frying pan.
The worm turns quickly in the world of politics.
The new student quickly made friends with the other musicians, because birds of a feather flock together.
words.defineEn: with a lot of speed
words.defineVi: với rất nhiều tốc độ

examples: Sadly, new customers are being enticed by tempting promotions only to find the dice are loaded against them.
"The good die young," said the pastor sadly at Robert's funeral, for even at the age of 80, his kindness, faith and generosity made his passing feel far too soon.
I hired Jess only because she thinks quick on her feet, an attribute that you sadly do not possess.
She should have known better than to trust him again after he had already betrayed her once, yet sadly it is a silly fish that is caught twice with the same bait.
because, sadly, the groom died.
words.defineEn: used to express that something is sad, regrettable, or unfortunate
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện rằng một cái gì đó là buồn, đáng tiếc, hoặc không may

examples: No one took me seriously because of my lack of experience and seniority.
Wait, he seriously thinks the most popular girl in school would go out with him?
f you keep crying wolf, people won't take you seriously when you really need them.
I wish you'd take me seriously.
Don't take them seriously, the wine has gone to their heads.
words.defineEn: to a degree or extent that is severe
words.defineVi: ở một mức độ hoặc mức độ nghiêm trọng

examples: This disaster comes hard on the heels of last week’s train crash.
The kids always work hard at school.
For Walter, disaster followed hard on the heels of his initial success.
Life on the road can be very hard.
She worked hard toward her degree.
words.defineEn: needing a lot of skill or effort to do
words.defineVi: cần rất nhiều kỹ năng hoặc nỗ lực để làm

examples: The horse took the first fence well.
Generally, the article reads very well.
The car holds the corners very well.
The glue is taking well.
In this grim little episode, few people come out well.
words.defineEn: in a way that is right, good, or satisfactory
words.defineVi: trong một cách đó là đúng, tốt, hoặc thỏa đáng

examples: Bad weather brought chaos to the utility companies.
Bad luck often brings good luck.
The bad weather brought famine.
Don’t use bad language.
Bad manners will get you nowhere.
words.defineEn: having a standard or quality that is unsatisfying
words.defineVi: có tiêu chuẩn hoặc chất lượng không thỏa mãn

examples: They both pay their employees badly.
This company badly needs to bring in some new blood.
The evening started badly when the speaker failed to turn up.
We've done very badly as far as planning is concerned.
Jack vented his spleen at his wife whenever things went badly at work.
words.defineEn: to a great or serious degree or extent
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ lớn hoặc nghiêm trọng hoặc mức độ

examples: His frame spoke tiredness.
He spoke the final words of the play.
The brochure speaks of beautiful secluded grounds.
My mother spoke Russian.
Please speak more slowly.
words.defineEn: to use one's voice to express a particular feeling or to communicate information
words.defineVi: sử dụng giọng nói của một người để thể hiện một cảm giác cụ thể hoặc để truyền đạt thông tin

examples: Although she didn't speak the language fluently, she was able to get by with basic phrases and gestures.
He wants to become bilingual and speak multiple languages fluently.
Of course, not all deaf people can read English fluently.
It merges fluently with outer space, where there's no atmosphere at all.
People's opinions sway one way and ignore people who aren’t signing fluently.
words.defineEn: in an easy, effortless, and correct manner
words.defineVi: một cách dễ dàng, dễ dàng và chính xác

examples: A true leader walks the talk.
The old lady walked slowly with the support of her cane.
The father proudly walked his daughter down the aisle on her wedding day.
They walk their dogs every day.
She walked the horse around the ring.
words.defineEn: to move forward at a regular speed by placing our feet in front of each other one by one
words.defineVi: di chuyển về phía trước với tốc độ đều đặn bằng cách đặt chân của chúng ta trước mặt nhau từng cái một

examples: Sales are growing fast.
Things certainly move fast in the blogosphere.
He takes bends much too fast.
The fast runner won the race by a wide margin.
He's going too fast.
words.defineEn: having a high speed when moving or doing something
words.defineVi: có tốc độ cao khi di chuyển hoặc làm gì đó

examples: Troops drove out the demonstrators.
Hunger drives the wolf out of the wood.
A stream of black cars drove by.
A stream of black cars drove by.
The waves drove against the shore.
words.defineEn: to control the movement and the speed of a car, bus, truck, etc. when it is moving
words.defineVi: để kiểm soát chuyển động và tốc độ của ô tô, xe buýt, xe tải, v.v. khi nó đang di chuyển

examples: The chef carefully arranged the arugula leaves on the plate as a beautiful garnish.
The child carefully planted caryopses of wildflowers in the garden.
The lioness carefully groomed her newborn baby.
Please drive carefully.
She carefully sprinkled sunflower seeds on top of her homemade bread dough.
words.defineEn: with a lot of care or attention
words.defineVi: với rất nhiều quan tâm hoặc chú ý

examples: Three cheers for Sarah, whose brilliant goal at the last minute won us the game!
The fast runner won the race by a wide margin.
Which team won?
The proposal has won the approval of the city council.
Our team actually won!
words.defineEn: to become the most successful, the luckiest, or the best in a game, race, fight, etc.
words.defineVi: để trở thành người thành công nhất, may mắn nhất hoặc giỏi nhất trong một trò chơi, cuộc đua, cuộc chiến, v.v.

examples: That kick of yours could have easily made mincemeat of my face.
Ciphers are easily broken by the new wonder machines.
Memorizing important dates in history came easily to him in school.
He picked up the new language easily by listening to podcasts.
Booksellers should easily be able to move this biography of Lincoln.
words.defineEn: with no problem or difficulty
words.defineVi: không có vấn đề hoặc khó khăn

examples: The slow train arrived at the station behind schedule.
Has the train from Bristol arrived?
The fast train arrived at the destination in no time.
Replies to the advertisement are arriving in fits and starts.
The elevator arrived after a couple of minutes of waiting.
words.defineEn: to reach a location, particularly as an end to a journey
words.defineVi: để đạt được một địa điểm, đặc biệt là kết thúc một cuộc hành trình

examples: Spring came late this year.
Her latest novel takes the lid off the international art world.
The government's latest proposals are a dog's dinner.
She was only five minutes late!
The latest smartphone is now on the market.
words.defineEn: doing or happening not at the time that is usual or expected, but after it
words.defineVi: làm hoặc xảy ra không phải vào thời điểm thông thường hoặc dự kiến, nhưng sau đó

examples: All newspapers sang from the same song sheet.
We sang songs to pass the time.
She can't sing for toffee.
Every night she sings the baby to sleep.
Cheerleaders from both schools sang the National Anthem before the start of the game and there were chills down my spine.
words.defineEn: to use our voice in order to produce musical sounds in the form of a tune or song
words.defineVi: sử dụng giọng nói của chúng tôi để tạo ra âm thanh âm nhạc dưới dạng một giai điệu hoặc bài hát

examples: The children were all sitting quietly and listening.
I was in Vienna sitting quietly in a café when, lo and behold, my cousin walked in.
We all sat sipping our tea quietly, no one wanting to bring up the white elephant in the room about Joel's expulsion from college.
the doctor asked Mr. Rinaldi quietly.
Quietly, their boat moved nearer.
words.defineEn: in a manner that makes very little or no noise
words.defineVi: theo cách mà làm cho rất ít hoặc không có tiếng ồn

examples: We all left the room silently.
We all left the room silently.
She used to go silently in and out of the room with a plate of food or a glass of beer.
So in a 1982 study, researchers told participants to silently read tongue twisters.
That way, they can silently stalk their prey until they’re close enough to pounce.
words.defineEn: without speaking or making any sound
words.defineVi: mà không nói hoặc làm cho bất kỳ âm thanh

examples: Fortunately it's not doom and gloom for all businesses, in spite of the economic situation.
I was nervous when I had to tell him that he was wrong, but fortunately he took it in good part and we stayed friends.
Fortunately Manfred arrived just in time and talked some sense into her.
You marching here alone only proves that you're having death wish, but fortunately it is something that I can help you with.
Fortunately, on Earth, the ozone layer blocks gamma rays.
words.defineEn: to express that something good happened or something bad did not happen because of good luck
words.defineVi: để diễn đạt rằng một cái gì đó tốt đã xảy ra hoặc một cái gì đó xấu đã không xảy ra vì may mắn

examples: The students worked their heart and soul on their project.
Not working my foot.
Soymilk works well as a substitute for milk in sauces and creamy pasta dishes.
My dad works forty hours a week.
To work clay.
words.defineEn: to do certain physical or mental activities in order to achieve a result or as a part of our job
words.defineVi: để làm một số hoạt động thể chất hoặc tinh thần để đạt được một kết quả hoặc là một phần của công việc của chúng tôi

examples: The team took a terrible beating.
You've made a terrible mess of this job.
I had terrible butterflies before I gave that talk in Venice.
The situation was terrible, but like many politicians he was attracted by troubled waters.
The entire region has been in the grip of a terrible drought.
words.defineEn: very bad, disagreeable, or unpleasant
words.defineVi: rất xấu, khó chịu, hoặc khó chịu

examples: Unfortunately, experience is the teacher of fools.
Unfortunately, the price of short ribs can be quite high.
Unfortunately, the president struck the wrong note in his speech, ignoring the public mood.
Unfortunately, most companies won't take a long look in the mirror until something goes disastrously wrong.
Unfortunately, I had to give the party a pass because I had a migraine last night.
words.defineEn: used to express regret or say that something is disappointing or sad
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện sự hối tiếc hoặc nói rằng một cái gì đó là thất vọng hoặc buồn

examples: He took up the reins of government immediately after the coup.
I immediately ordered a plate of Mediterranean busiate, which was prepared with artichoke and feta.
See your doctor immediately if you pass any blood.
She's wanted immediately in the director's office.
They hit it off immediately when they met at the party.
words.defineEn: in a way that is instant and involves no delay
words.defineVi: theo cách đó là ngay lập tức và không có sự chậm trễ

examples: She wears her hair long.
This policy is no longer an effective means to an end.
Our players kept the pedal to the metal all season long.
The kids are under my feet all day long.
North Korea’s refusal had long been a sticking point.
words.defineEn: (of two points) having an above-average or big distance between them
words.defineVi: (của hai điểm) có khoảng cách trên trung bình hoặc lớn giữa chúng

examples: Such cheap goods obviously rely on dirt cheap labor.
Obviously, over the years, this changed but my car remained behind the times with its cassette player.
He obviously didn’t realize he was swimming with sharks!
I was furious but just left it at that since he obviously didn't care about me.
And obviously, tons of people mistake Twitter bots for humans all the time.
words.defineEn: in a way that is easily understandable or noticeable
words.defineVi: theo cách dễ hiểu hoặc đáng chú ý

examples: Suddenly another soldier hits the dirt beside me.
My father died suddenly at the age of 48.
A man suddenly appeared from behind a tree.
Quite suddenly, her mind was made up.
Suddenly things started happening.
words.defineEn: quickly and unexpectedly
words.defineVi: một cách nhanh chóng và bất ngờ

examples: Samantha played it cool during the storm, calmly directing people to safety and finding extra food and water for everyone.
A mother calmly reassures her terrified child that the robots are not looking for her.
"Speak slowly, calmly and clearly."
She went on sewing calmly.
Calmly, might I add.
words.defineEn: without stress or strong emotion
words.defineVi: không căng thẳng hoặc cảm xúc mạnh mẽ

examples: The days passed slowly.
The day and night passed slowly.
The blades of the helicopter were turning slowly.
The old lady walked slowly with the support of her cane.
He slowly raised his head up.
words.defineEn: moving or doing something at a slow speed; not quickly
words.defineVi: di chuyển hoặc làm điều gì đó với tốc độ chậm; không nhanh chóng
